title: Easy Tuna Patties Recipe
description: These tuna patties, seasoned with Italian breadcrumbs and Parmesan, are tender inside and crisp outside. They make a great appetizer or hot sandwich.

Recipes Easy Tuna Patties 4.6 (639) 505 Reviews 147 Photos These tuna patties are delicious dipped in ketchup, mustard, or hot sauce. They are also great served as a hot sandwich. Submitted by Phyllis Spencer Brixey Updated on June 7, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 147 147 147 147 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 eggs 2 teaspoons lemon juice 10 tablespoons Italian-seasoned bread crumbs 3 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese 3 (5 ounce) cans tuna, drained 3 tablespoons diced onion 1 pinch ground black pepper 3 tablespoons vegetable oil Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Beat eggs and lemon juice in a bowl; stir in bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese to make a paste. Fold in tuna and onion until well combined; season with black pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Use your hands to shape tuna mixture into 8 (1-inch-thick) patties. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry patties in the hot oil until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 1,687 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 325 Calories 16g Fat 14g Carbs 31g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 325 % Daily Value * Total Fat 16g 20% Saturated Fat 3g 16% Cholesterol 125mg 42% Sodium 409mg 18% Total Carbohydrate 14g 5% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 1g Protein 31g 63% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 93mg 7% Iron 3mg 16% Potassium 279mg 6% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Tuna Patties 01 of 147 Photo by¬† Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 147 Photo by¬† Strawberry Blonde 02/10/2025 Make sure to get the oil hot. Also- don‚Äôt drain one or two of the cans. I had a hard time keeping the patties from flaking and breaking. I used Albacore.While these patties weren‚Äôt a favorite at my house, I think some families would. Made plenty for a family of up to 4. Nice and filling, too. 03 of 147 Photo by¬† AmberKelp3156 09/26/2024 Worth the effort Great flavors I cut the recipe in half because it was only me eating. But I did add a teaspoon of garlic scape pesto, quarter teaspoon salt free vegetable seasoning, two teaspoons dried home made chives, pepper flakes and unflavored panko instead of Italian. I also made a sauce to go with them.I changed the original recipe quite a bit , it is a very good base recipe. SAUCE: 2 tbs half fat mayo, 1/2 tsp srirracha sauce and 1 tsp Arby's horsey sauce.* In hindsight, I would have readded a little tuna water back into the mix.They cook well in a pan with a little olive oil!Very tasty. Definitely will make again. 04 of 147 Photo by¬† FlimsyPrune1307 04/04/2024 A keeper! I never know how much binder to use these were wonderful Thank you 05 of 147 Photo by¬† Sherry 03/05/2024 A keeper! Worth the effort Easy to follow I am not a big fan of tuna but like to make for hubby every now and then. These were so easy to make. Served on toasted buns with homemade tartar sauce, dill pickles and lettuce. Surprise for me, I found these to be delicious. 06 of 147 Photo by¬† Allrecipes Member 02/18/2024 A little dry, a little too chewy. OK though, for a quick snack... 07 of 147 Photo by¬† Genie 10/06/2023 Really yummy! I added extra onion, oregano and some Cajun seasoning to mine and a bit more pepper. These are easy and delicious!!! 08 of 147 Photo by¬† Tara Ludwig 09/07/2023 I really liked these. I made 2 changes because I didn‚Äôt have what the recipe called for - I substituted dill pickle juice for the lemon juice and added 1 tablespoon Italian seasoning and used regular breadcrumbs. Turned out perfect with lots of flavour. Served them with tartar sauce, some rice and roasted veggies. Yum! 09 of 147 Photo by¬† LoftyPita2984 09/13/2022 Best recipe and so easy to make.Thank you üòä 10 of 147 Photo by¬† Paula 05/19/2022 My family really enjoyed these. I followed the recipe but also added a little bit of the breadcrumbs to the outside before frying. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Spicy Canned Tuna Fish Cakes 13 Ratings Bisnonna's Tuna Parmesan 2 Ratings Super Easy Salmon Cakes 122 Ratings Simple Salmon Cakes Made with Oatmeal 11 Ratings Salmon Cakes for One 33 Ratings Easy Salmon Cakes 146 Ratings Pretzel-Crusted Salmon Patties 2 Ratings Easy Salmon Patties 13 Ratings Tasty Tuna Burgers 582 Ratings Salmon Tuna Patties 15 Ratings Thirty-Minute Baked Tuna Burgers 14 Ratings Air Fryer Salmon Croquettes 26 Ratings Scrumptious Salmon Cakes 534 Ratings Tangy Tuna Black Bean Quesadillas 72 Ratings NSNG Keto Salmon Patties 4 Ratings Tasty Tuna Patties 3 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family. name: Phyllis Spencer Brixey
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Beat eggs and lemon juice in a bowl; stir in bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese to make a paste. Fold in tuna and onion until well combined; season with black pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Use your hands to shape tuna mixture into 8 (1-inch-thick) patties. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry patties in the hot oil until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Serve and enjoy!
